Tony Dungy said when asked why Michael Vick was hosting a party. He is not going to be attending. I don't know where it started or what, but he's not going to be there. I think he understands it's something that's just not worth it to him. The Philadelphia Eagles said on Thursday that Michael Vick would not be attending the party. NFC starting quarterback Michael Vick of Philadelphia probably appreciates his appearance more than anyone on either side of the ball, considering how far he has come since serving prison time for his role in dogfighting operation. This one feels great due to the fact that I've been through so much and trained to getting back to this position, he said earlier this week. "It's paramount for me and my family and I'm just thankful."

its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice-president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., among its fiercest rival. Microsoft

Hopes to Garner Respect After a detailed recap of the 800-page memoir, The Daily Beast's Howard Kurtz concludes with Bush's decision to finally ask for Donald Rumsfeld 's resignation. The Dick Cheney is quoted as saying, This is hard for me. You're a pro. You're a hell of a lot better than others in this town. Howard Kurtz suspects that Donald Rumsfeld 's goal with this memoir is to leave readers with the same conclusion. "But it contains few surprises and, after so many years of divisive debate, is unlikely to change many minds
